page.title: 03KING CHARLES' HOTEL VENTNOR.
page.content: When you walk into the King Charles Hotel it is like walking back into the past. Mr. and Mrs. Barton have filled the reception rooms with antiques and chandeliers hang from the ceiling. The present hotel was built next to the original Crab and Lobster Inn in 1875. It has 25 bedrooms none of which has a private bathroom because the situation of the hotel makes it impossible to change the plumbing system. About 40 people stay at the hotel each week and most of them come from the London area. The hotel provides bed, breakfast and evening meals as well as packed lunches for school parties. Some rooms have a television and there is a games room. About 15 people work at the hotel. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel and this is also appreciated by local residents.
